alfredsnippet.snippet:
The Nature of the Physical World, Arthur Eddington (1929)

"When I think of an electron there rises to my mind a hard, red, tiny ball; the proton similarly is neutral grey. Of course the color is absurd -- perhaps not more absurd than the rest of the conception -- but I am incorrigible."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Eddington Discusses His Particle Bias
